property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={210, 23, 855, 627}, maximized=false}

property.name: runCommand
property.value: node ../../hosts/node/nodeHostInvoke.js -timeout 6000 test/auto/@modelName@

property.name: text
property.value: This model generates an composite accessor that uses both a Display and a Test.

property.name: text
property.value: Double click on this code generator to generate code and run it locally.

property.name: text
property.value: This code generator runs the composite accessor on a remote machine that has node and npm installed. If you do not have access to the sbuser account, then change the userHost parameter to be a username and an machine name. If you have ssh set up on your local machine, then you could use localhost.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Test accessor that spontaneously produces outputs once per time interval. This implementation produces a counting sequence.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee

property.name: output (port)
property.value: Output for the counting sequence, of type number.

property.name: interval (parameter)
property.value: The interval between outputs in milliseconds.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Display data on the console.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Accessor that stops execution of the enclosing swarmlet when it receives an input with value true. It does this by identifying the top-level enclosing composite accessor and invoking wrapup on it.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee (eal@eecs.berkeley.edu)

property.name: stop (port)
property.value: A signal with value true to stop the swarmlet.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Compare the input with a known good input. If you set ''trainingMode'' to true and provide inputs, then the inputs will be recorded in the ''correctValues'' parameters. Otherwise, the inputs will be compared against those in the ''correctValue'' parameter.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks based on the Ptolemy NonStrictTest actor by Paul Whitaker, Christopher Hylands, Edward A. Lee

property.name: input (port)
property.value: The input value.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: False as long as there is data to compare against the input
